metadata.title: CVE-2024-49936 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/xen-netback: prevent UAF in xenvif_flush_hash()During the list_for_each_entry_rcu iteration call of xenvif_flush_hash,kfree_rcu does not exist inside the rcu read critical section, so ifkfree_rcu is called when the rcu grace period ends during the iteration,UAF occurs when accessing head->next after the entry becomes free.Therefore, to solve this, you need to change it tolist_for_each_entry_safe.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
